Posts.Content: Hi Rebecca Sorry to hear about your diagnosis. I too am having chemo first to shrink my lump. I visited my chemo unit first and also had a half hour chat with one of the nurses for her to go through what would happen, possible side effects, what to bring with me etc I also got to ask questions including coldcap questions. I found this really helpful. This was just after my first Onc appt so you may find they do the same, if not it's worth asking. I've had one round up to now. Wore my own clothes, didn' t have make up but wasn't told I couldn't I just don't wear it in the day. I sat in what was like an upright dentists chair, very comfy. I used the cold cap and at the moment I haven't had any hair loss. I'm on Day 18 now and generally I've read hair can start going around Day 14 so I'm hoping the cap is working. That said I have my second round this week so we'll see if that makes a difference. I think the odds are pretty 50/50 from what I've read. Works for some, I'm hoping I might be lucky. It really doesn't cause that much discomfort. The first 15 mins are the worst and then you honestly just forget it's there. It just adds a lot of time to your session as you have to have it on 45 mins before chemo and 2 hours after. Worth it though if it works. Take some paracetamol about 30 mins to an hour before your session. It is a personal thing and I know some don't get on with it but I found it totally fine and no headaches after and I'm quite a headachey person. Good luck with it all. Lots of love xxxx
Posts.Title: Is the cold cap worth it and chemo questions

Posts.Content: Hi Dorothee I didn't think you were being rude, I know you didn't mean it that way! We just all reply from our own individual experiences. I feel a bit rude not asking about your first chemo, sorry! how did it go and how are you feeling? Hope the steroids are working for you. Do you have anti sickness meds, which chemo are you on? I'm feeling a bit low leading up to the second one, I'm not worried it just puts you out of action and I feel guilty not being able to do much with kids/hubby. I was ill all last week as well so didn't do much then either. I suppose it's because I've got another Onc appt as well and so it's all real again this week. That said, I've felt a real difference in lump size since first treatment and have no redness now so I am also 'excited' (wrong word!) to get it in my system again. Hope yours went ok and you're not feeling too bad. Lots of love xxxxx
Posts.Title: Is the cold cap worth it and chemo questions

Posts.Content: Hi Rebecca I miss not being able to do my hair properly, but it doesn't look too bad at all really. Still better than none. Just do whatever you comfortable with as regards your modelling, take it easy as well as you need to get lots of rest after a chemo session. If you're not going to try the cap, the chemo is only about 40 minutes...that's the plus side of not using it!! Keep us up to date with how you;re doing. Lots of love xxxxx
Posts.Title: Is the cold cap worth it and chemo questions

Posts.Content: Hi Sascha So sorry for your shitty appointment, even though you were probably 'prepared' for it it is still inexcusable how you have been treated. how can you feel safe with your life in their hands when they are so cold. When are you coming over for a second opinion? Not just for that but to hopefully talk to someone who really cares about you. The first thing I remember about my ONC is that whenI sat down, bolt upright he told me to relax and that we were all friends in the room and I really did. That's what you need when you are going through something like this. I hope you are coming over asap so that it can give you some confidence about what will happen. I'm on the FEC, first 2 days...mostly slept as felt bit wobbly and sick. Haven't been sick though. Feeling tired and sicky has been the worst for me but started to get better yesterday which was Day 5. I suppose it's too early for me to give you any real advice but I know it's not as bad as I thought it would be. I feel 'pregnant' not much appetite, certain foods/smells making me nauseous. Not sure when hair will go, used cold cap and am a bit nervous about infection risk...especially with the kids and the germs they bring home! I haven't had constipation or diarrhoea...just been normal in that dept so all in all not bad really. Sorry today was awful, I know you mentioned prognosis without chemo but I reckon that would be about it for most of us without it. I bet with chemo you have a much, much better prognosis and maybe him only giving you 4 FEC this won't be as hard on you. I'm having 6. Sending you lots of love and hugs xxxxx

Posts.Title: Proposed chemo regime - looking for advice, info, help please

Posts.Content: Hi I'm having reflexology at the moment which I'm finding really relaxing and boosts my energy. I started my second lot of chemo this week and asked if i would be ok to carry on and the chemo nurse said it was fine but they didn't like you to have any invasive stuff like acupuncture whilst on chemo. I know you've said you've not started it yet anyway but just thought i would pass this on to you for you to ask too before you begin chemo. The hypnotherapy sounds interesting :) xxx

Haha! I  keep fresh, even though I use the cold cap!! I know what you are trying to say though Dorothee! You can still care for your hair, just not blow dry (can cold blow dry) or use straighteners. I still use my normal shampoo and conditioner as chemo nurse said if you used it before, no need to change. She did say using Simple shampoo and conditioner was good but I found it doesn't condition enough so just use what I did before chemo. I tend to bath more than shower now so I'm not wetting hair unecessarily. I suppose as a model not being able to 'do' your hair will be more of a problem, It's a good point to bring up though as you're not supposed to wash or brush it as often, but I brush mine and put it up in a scrunchy or loose clip and it's fine. If it does come out then so be it, will just opt for scarves. I have 2 young boys 7 and 3 and just wanted to keep looking 'normal' for them. Another good point Dorothee has made is ipod and books, makes the time fly! Lots of love xxx
Posts.Title: Is the cold cap worth it and chemo questions

Posts.Content: Hi Rosielee What is it you are feeling unsure of? Is it how treatment will go etc. I had my first chemo 11 days ago now and it really isn't as bad as I imagined. I presume all your surgery is over? If so, at least you will be cracking on with chemo and nearing the end of treatment. I'm doing it the other way round, chemo then surgery. I'm exactly like you, I have days where I'm positive and strong and then others when I think negative things all day and keep crying. We all do, it's only natural. Ok, we's all like to be positive 24/7 but we are only human and bound to be frightened. I know I am. Keep coming on here and writing, it really helps...you should look back at all my posts I'm always worrying about something or just offloading when I feel down! Someone, or lots of others on here usually say something to perk me back up. I find most of my support on here, my family are good too-hubby is great. But no-one really understands what it's like. Only others on here who have been through it or going through it. No questions are too silly and no-one minds if you just want to offload. I hope coming on here helps and if you want to send me a message anytime if you don't feel like posting, feel free :) I totally understand how you feel, we all do. Lots of love and a big hug xxxxxxxx
Posts.Title: Feeling as though the cancer is now real

Posts.Content: Hi Carol and Wendy That's such GOOD news, I'm so pleased for you both. What great news for xmas! Much Love xxxx
Posts.Title: Finally some good news

Posts.Content: Hi Carol and Wendy That's such GOOD news, I'm so pleased for you both. What great news for xmas! Much Love xxxx
Posts.Title: Finally some good news

Posts.Content: am getting nervous now after reading some of the stories on here. Chemo nurse told me not to paint nails dark but use clear strengthener so that you can see what's happening with nails. Was tols to drink lots of water too. when do the aches and pains usually kick in? Luckily i was prescribed tramadol las week for sore boob so am storing these incase the pain is bad. Any other tips? I started my steroids today as nurse said it can stop you having a reaction to the tax as this can happen but quite rare, this has scared me a bit...and will be at the back of my mind. hopefully all will be ok. Looking forward to not having the cold cap and not being there for 4 hours because of it!! Lots of love xxx
Posts.Title: First tax tomorrow, any tips

Posts.Content: Ooooh, thanks both of you. I have got redness and swelling around it and because I had the soreness as well I was worrying. A lot of the redness has gone down tonight. I actually smiled when I read these posts as I am thinking about how much good the chemo is doing in there, fighting away for me. It feels good to be having treatment after weeks of just tests. Thank you both for your reassurance. If it gets any worse or i start to worry again I'll give my BC nurse a ring. Lots of love xxxx
Posts.Title: sore breast lump and armpit

Posts.Content: Hi So sorry you've had to join us but you'll get plenty of support here and be able to come and vent your worries. The initial diagnosis really is the worst time, I still wonder how I got through it. I went through all the same emotions. Believe me, once you do crack on with treatment you do feel 'calmer' and have something to focus on and a timeline. I'm like you and have chemo first, I am having FEC for 6 sessions, had second one yesterday. Actual treatment and side effects have been fine not half as bad as I imagined. I was really worried about this too. I have 7 and 3 year old boys and just wondered how I would fit treatment/side effects in but luckily have an amazing husband and family. If you have this support too it will be of great help to you. Give yourself time to get your head around things and it will get a bit easier. It's a very up and down journey and not easy at times but you will get through it. Well done on your race for life achievement! I think having your wedding next year is a great focus and something nice to look forward too. I have been looking at holidays somewhere hot and tropical for next April/May...that's my focus! Keep coming on here, it really helps. Don't know what I would have done without all the lovely ladies and their support and advice. Lots of love xxxxxx
Posts.Title: 28 & newly diagnosed

Posts.Content: Hi My 7 year old son is the same. We have only said I'm poorly and need to go to the hospital occassionly for medicine. I was diagnosed in May, through the holidays he was a pain and he lashes out mostly at his Dad. He actually hit him in the face last night and my husband was so upset he cried...but he doesn't punish him and I told him to do what we've always done. I actually find he's worse when he's tired so I make sure he starts getting ready for bed early..easier now the nights are drawing in. I find it difficult as it could be his age and he started Junior school this term so he could be worrying about that. He probably is picking up things but I get really upset when I try and talk to friends and family about it as they always say it's beause I'm ill so then I feel massively guilty. There's so much to deal with with this illness and a lot of guilt. All we can do as others have suggested is do what we always have, even if it's hard. Good luck xxx
Posts.Title: effecting my son

Posts.Content: Evening Ladies I've always had some soreness in my breast lump and armpit, since before diagnosis but the last few days it seems to be worse. Have been taking paracetamol for it. I am wondering if it could be anything to do with the chemo I had last Thursday, maybe it's doing it's magic? The only other scary alternative I thought was maybe the lump is still growing :( I was going to see how I was in the morning and then ring the BC nurse. I really don't want to though as I'm trying to keep away from professionals/hospitals in these 3 weeks before next chemo. Had my fill over the last few weeks! Thought I'd check here for advice first :) lots of love xxx
Posts.Title: sore breast lump and armpit

Posts.Content: Myself and hubby talk about this all the time. Everytime we catch up with relatives, they'll always say...let is know if you want anything, let us know if you want us to take the kids off your hands for a few hours blah, blah. We both agree that we would prefer it if they actually said something like 'we'll have the kids on Saturday' you know, an actual day/time etc as then we would probably take them up on their offer but you just know they think it's the right think to say and that we wouldn't really take them up on their offer if you know what I mean. We generally don't ask for help, and we generally don't get any real offers. My mum is the only one who will just say...'I'll have the kids this weekend' She has been our lifesaver through this. xx

Posts.Title: Chemo starting next Tuesday

Posts.Content: HI Yvonne It's brilliant how you've treated the wig thing but it is still an emotional time. If it was just a wig without the cancer I'm sure it would be different but this journey is so up and down. I always have highs followed by lows but the important thing is you still have occassional highs. I had a good hair day yesterday, I've kept most of mine using the cold cap, I cut myself a fringe and blow dried it for the first time in months (I'm due my last FEC soon) and I liked how I looked for the first time in months! I had a lovely afternoon out with my Mum but I still ended up going to bed last night in one of my panic moments, worrying about everything. I don't know if it's a bit of when we feel good  we forget about things so when we remember things come crashing down again. That's my analogy of things anyway....we don't really want this do we. I hope you feel a bit better soon and bet you look fab at the moment :) lots of love xxxxx

Posts.Title: Chemo starting next Tuesday

Posts.Content: Hi Catherine You are not being shallow at all. Of course it's going to really upset you. I know I will be in tears and it will be downhill for a bit. It really is a big deal. I keep getting a 'tingle' here and there and next week will be 2 weeks after first chemo so I reckon I'm going to be losing it. It's just something else to make it more real. It won't be long before this is all over and it will be growing back. It's such good news about your lump so as i keep being told "chemo is your friend" Hard to feel like that sometimes, I know. I'm off to wash mine in a mo. I've left it for as long as I can-about a week now as not been out this weekend. Am wondering if some will come out. Did you use cold cap this time? Sorry to hear your feeling wiped out too. I felt like that Days 2-5 but then felt ok. I'm really hoping it will be the same next time. Yesterday was the first day I didn't take any sickness meds. Hoping I feel ok now until the next round. Just remember to ring them if you feel wiped out for too long, hoping you'll be on the up very soon. Lots of love and a big hug xxxxxxxxxxxxxx
Posts.Title: Shrinkage after Round Chemo round !!

Posts.Content: Big hug to you Jo. Are you feeling a bit better today. Have you just had another round of chemo? Sorry to hear about your hair. I think there's a few going and I maybe joinging you. Haven't heard from anyone on here who has kept theirs, or maybe I've missed it. We're all here to support each other through this crappy time. It won't be long before it's all growing back again :) xxxxx
Posts.Title: Shrinkage after Round Chemo round !!

Posts.Content: OMG! I am so happy for you, I am also being selfish and thinking about my lump shrinking. Hope I have such an effect :) Hurray for chemo-hopefully it's the FEC variety that's helping! Well done for getting round 2 done and dusted. Get plenty of rest and definitely champers when you feel up to it, I know I would! xxxxxxx
Posts.Title: Shrinkage after Round Chemo round !!

Posts.Content: Hi Sammy You're post just breaks my heart, mainly because of your strong emotions. I can really feel your hurt and pain and it is such a shock. But please don't see it as the end just yet. Talking about dividing her stuff will only add to your heartache and there is so much that can be done for your sister. Others have said on here too and I have took comfort from these posts I have breast cancer that has moved to lungs so understand all the scary stuff. I was only diagnosed in May but am now just living my life. I have 3 children, one at university and a 7 and 4 year old and I cried so much thinking I won't see them grow up but I am not going to be beaten yet. My ONC said I will just be treated as though I have a chronic illness and her words 'there are lots of treatments out there' These things may not be 'cured' but they can be kept under control for many, many years and being at the Royal Marsden is absolutely amazing. I don't know if you have been on the breastcancercare.org website but their secondaries forum is great and there is even a thread for 'success stories' ladies on there 8,9,10 years past diagnosis and they are just the ones who post. There are many people out there getting on with their lives as treatments are so advanced now. Take a look, just reading these from time time makes my day. We don't know what's around the corner..there's no 100% guarantee we'll all be around when we're 'old' so for now, if you can I know it's hard take one day at a time and think about your sister being in the best hands and you having many more years together. Sending you lots of love xxxx
Posts.Title: Sister has just been diagnosed with secondary Liver Cancer

Posts.Content: Thanks everyone for your messages, I know I must sound very irrational but my fear of this disease and dying seems to have taken over at the moment. I have just met my Mum in town for a coffee and being out has made me a bit more rational. I am going to wait to see what the Onc says tomorrow and try and just not think about it. Sascha, I don't know if you remember but had a horrible Onc appt where she said bluntly they wouldn't give me surgery as they didn't think it would make any difference...unless my boob was giving me problems pain etc she said because of lung mets I would have chemo with breaks in between to keep me stable. The other Onc said he wouldn't plan any treatment until this lot had finished and I had another scan to see what was happening with lungs as mets only small and would hopefully shrink. I suppose this is why my head is all over as I don't have a proper plan and the Onc I don't like is not very positive, all though saying that she did say there are lots of 'treatments but I just took that as chemo as this is what she had said earlier. i know I need to get things clear but last time I asked i came out in tears and terrified by what she told me and ever since I think I've only got a short time and now with boob flaring up etc I'm convinced that's it for me. i know all of this sounds really stupid and OTT but I really can't help it. I think i'm just drowing in it all. I upset my inlaws last week as when I had a crying meltdown I said I wish i was dead as then I wouldn't worry. Sometimes I feel like that and others I want to fight to stay alive. My children will be back soon so I won't have time to think and I got the M&S tenner meal deal for hubby and I to have a nice meal tonight so hopefully all at the back of my mind tomorrow. That's going to be interesting...a blubbing wrech is what they'll be getting. Catherine...lump not 1cmx1cm...I wish!!!! It had shrunk by this much last time when I dodn't think it had. It's still big but shrunk 5cmx4cm in all so the chemo has been working. Thanks again everyone, sorry for coming across as a nutter!!!! xxxxx
Posts.Title: really scared

Posts.Content: Morning everyone I'm a bit of a stuck record at the moment, worrying about chemo not working etc. I got really low yesterday and spent most of it crying. Was a bit uncontrollable in the evening and just stayed in my bedroom. Am so worried about these patches that have appeared on my boob with lump. After first chemo all the redness and patches disappeared and lump reduced a lot. Now the patches are back and the lump doesn't seem to have gone down much. I did think that last time but it had gone down 1cmx1cm. I suppose I can't expect a dramatic reduction every time. I am just worried sick about theses patches. I'm sure it must mean it's not working and that the cancer is winning again. I feel sick and have already started the day in tears. Luckily the kids are at their grandparents and hubby has gone off to work. I have Onc appt tomorrow and I am absolutely terrified, I am always scared anyway. Being TN chemo is all I have, I was so positive when I could see the improvement in my breast and now I'm just expected awful news tomorrow. My mind has gone haywire and i'm just thinking what if this is it and they can't do anything for me because my cancer is so aggressive. I'm a real mess today and I'm so used to just getting on with things as normal xx
Posts.Title: really scared

Posts.Content: Hi Chelle I would get yourself booked on one asap. I booked mine before first chemo. I went into the macmillan info centre at my hospital and they had just literally had someone cancel. They were about to ring people from the waiting list but she offered it me :) How lucky was I!! She said they were popular so I would definitely look into it as soon as you can. I'll let you know how it goes xxx
Posts.Title: Hairy Question

Hubby has talked to them about me being ill, not in loads of detail and not the 'c' word. just think they're too young to get their head around it. It does get very real once the chemo starts, I had my first last thursday. Finding things a bit difficult emotionally, think just with it being the first but also trying to remember I've started so I can finish! As will you :) Lots of love and big hugs xxxx
Posts.Title: Telling Young Children About Hair Loss

Posts.Content: Hi Ladies. It'll be my 3rd tax next week and I teallt dont think I can do it. First one was awful so they lowered the dose this time. Its not quite as bad but bad enough to have no quality of life. I have no energy, breathless at the slightest movement. Just no decent fitness level. Every littltr thing is such an effort I have completely lost the person I was and I just hate my life and me. I just think another dose is going to finish me off, I already keep thinking being dead will be easier as I only have a life of chemo ahead with having mets. I'm not even just saying that for attention, I really feel like that today. How will I cope? As I'm not xxx
Posts.Title: Don't think I can do another round :(

Posts.Content: Hi I'm booked on a 'look good feel great' next week! Am so excited for my goody bag! I'm Day 10 past first chemo so it will be interesting to see if I start losing hair next week especially as I've used the cold cap. I found the cold cap fine to use and the nurses snuggled me up in blankets so I didn't feel cold. had a couple of cups of tea as well. But hey-ho, as long as the chemo is doing it's magic on me i can live with it. I'm looking forward to being shown how to draw on eyebrows, what to do with eyelashes etc I have never been able to put make up on properly either so once I'm shown I'll definitely make more of an effort if I have a hairless head! xx

Posts.Content: Glad you got your treatment done Catherine! You're done my love!!!!! My Daniel Field stuff arrived this morning, very impressed as ordered thursday afternoon...chose free delivery which said can take up to 7 days but here it is this morn! Am excited! Not using it until Monday though as no time this weekend. But will let you know asap when I do and how I get on. I was a bit naughty yesterday, was a bit fed up of hair. I got the scissors out and cut myself a fringe! it actually looks loads better as I then blow dried it and straigthened it and left it down for the first time in months!!!!! Naughty naughty....I wouldn't use them every day or even week but I thought if I'm going out I will do. It's ok this morning, not all dropped out!!. I only had dryer and straighteners on a low heat, gave me a boost though to look a bit like my old self...but with a fringe haha! xx
Posts.Title: Naturtint Hair dye anyone used it on chemo?

Posts.Content: Am wondering whether to risk it, grey around front and my hair is dark. I'm only 40 but the grey is adding years on. am grateful to have my hair albeit, thin n grey! Posts.Title: Naturtint Hair dye anyone used it on chemo?

Posts.Content: Ahhhh, Catherine..what a love you are!!! Am not too bad now and people's comments help. Just have to remember I can be treated and I can look after myself to have a better outcome. I really wish I could think like this all the time but the chemo reall does fog me. I'll be doing it again next time having forgotten all this!!! Am nipping into town tomorrow to get some dye from H and B. Am going to give it a whirl. Got my youngest son's birthday party next week so am determined not to look like his Granny!!! I've not got loads of grey and I'm going to try and avoid scalp as much as I can. Am only going to do the grey bits, not a great deal really, not my whole head. I hope your chemo doesn't get delayed, especially with it being the last one. Am sure you'll be fine. Good luck lovely!! xx
Posts.Title: Naturtint Hair dye anyone used it on chemo?

It's just something else to deal with that you could do without. xx

Posts.Title: Naturtint Hair dye anyone used it on chemo?

Posts.Content: Thank you for kind words Sue. I met my macmillan nurse yesterday and had a good cry...it didn't take long before I was off!! She thinks I could do with some anti depressents asap and she made me feel better about how I'm feeling. I have felt so awful since first tax, still do and I have second one thursday which is still really worrying me. Had my bloods done today ready for thurs but the way I feel, it won't surprise me if there's a prob. Mac nurse was reassuring as I told her I thought I felt so awful because of the cancer and I was going to die soon...I'm sorry I know that's so morbid but she said it's the toxins in the chemo affecting me mentally and physically. I know I sound a bit 'mad' but it was good just to be able to say anything and her not think I'd lost the plot. I've made an appt to see the Dr re anti depressents, see if they help me cope more. I'm still worrying I haven't seen any change in boob since chemo, with feeling so crap it's well and truly in my system so why isn't it doing anything to boob/lump. Just fed up worrying xxx
Posts.Title: bone scan today and yet another whinge from me.....a warning then...

Posts.Content: Hi. Sorry to hear you're having to go through this again. Welcome to the site and I hope you find strength and support on here to help you through. Big hugs xxx
Posts.Title: Diagnosed with breast cancer for a second time in opposite breast

Posts.Content: Hi Ladies I went for my bone scan today. Wasn't the slightest bit worried by it.(the actual scan) Went in at 9.15 for injection and was told to come back at 12 so I nipped into town to do a bit of present shopping. Got back on time and was straight in the room. The radiographer started talking through what they would do, how the machine would cover my head/face first and be very close to my face....woah!! stop there!!!! I had a massive panic as wasn't expecting that. I just started saying I couldn't do it as claustrophobic and she said there was nothing on my notes and I said 'nobody asked'!!!! I cried....big baby! She was really lovely and said she could sit with me for the head bit and she would stop the camera coming to low.She said i should have been warned about the face bit. I was still a bit hesitant, she said it would only be for 5 mins so I just thought I've got to do it, no choice. Anyway, did it...was horrible but it helped having someone there talking about xmas etc. I was just really upset when i came out as felt embarrassed and am so sick of all this horrible hospital stuff. I KNOW it'll be in my bones, it's moving around everywhere else and I really don't know how I'll handle more bad news as I will just feel like that will be the end. I'm so sorry for being soooo morbid. I still feel rubbish from tax and I have my 2nd one next week, don't know how I'll cope. All I seem to want to do is drink but I have no appetite most of the time.....is this normal on tax? When I was on FEC, I felt crap for a week then normal for 2. This is very draining. Am also having a panic as just over 2 weeks since 1st tax and can't see any effect on lump size :( What if I'm someone chemo doesn't work on??? No good when you're triple negative. I'm so, so sorry to moan I just wish I could have something positive to cling to as depression and cancer are beating me and I don't want them too. Thank you for reading. Lots of love xxxxxx
Posts.Title: bone scan today and yet another whinge from me.....a warning then...

Posts.Content: haha! you are the first person to mmake me laugh today with the chemo not working comment....you can read me like a book. I have decided I AM going to be the only person chemo is not going to work for ;) hehe! I actually have a macmillan nurse coming to see me tuesday, at home. Never been in touch witn my BN and she's never been in touch with me, which I think says a lot really. I was ok and living with it all until scan a few weeks back showed crap results and all my treatment plan changed. I just haven't been 'right' since then. I was starting to take the dog on long walks for exercise but the tax has really wiped me out. I feel like a 90 year old woman. Thank you so much for replying and the nice big hug. Your post makes a lot of sense. I jut can't make myself see sense or hope for some good news or beat this for a few years at least and get a break from it. Thanks again xxxxxx
Posts.Title: bone scan today and yet another whinge from me.....a warning then...

Posts.Content: Hi Shelley I really, really feel for you. You're bound to be feeling so low and fed up with your body. I hope you get your sore skin and wound sorted asap. I seriously think tax has a real depressive side to it and we can't find that light at the end of the tunnel anymore. I've had my treatment plan thrown in the air as things are not 'working' so I know how frustrating and horribly down you must feel. You just want a little bit of good news or something positive in all this shitty treatment but it ends up being one thing after another. My hubby is being really good as well and like you, I feel a bit useless, feeling sorry for myself, with my hair slowly coming out....what a catch!! i think we have just lost the person we once were but it can't be this crap forever. I'm sure once your wound is a bit better that will help you and I'm crossing my fingers for you for chemo, it's not trivial to want to feel better for christmas. As soon as I got my dates for this second lot of chemo I worked out how it fell over christmas and luckily quite good!!!! I hope I haven't made you feel more depressed, just wanted to let you know I understand how you feel. Whinge as much as you like, i know your journey isn't an easy one but it will get better and it will get to the end before you know it, you've been amazingly strong. Sending you lots of love and hugs xxxxxx
Posts.Title: Why is it all going wrong?

Posts.Content: Hi They can change  a lot in just one day. I had my bloods done on the Tuesday before my last chemo, when I went for my Onc appointment they said I needed to do another test as I was too low for chemo. I too felt fine and I just thought 'Nooooooo, not on my last one!' was really worried it would be deferred. Had the bloods done then went for my appt and they were fine. If they hadn;t been they would have done another test on chemo day, so still time :) Good luck xx
Posts.Title: Pre chemo blood results are low

Posts.Content: Hi I had the same sort of pain, I found it disappeared once I started chemo but did have the odd twinge here and there. Speak to your Onc if you're really worried but I think it's quite normal and common. Good luck xxxxx

Posts.Content: I have advice books, have asked loads about diet etc but at the end of the day sometimes you can only fancy what you fancy. Sunday was my worst day after this last lot of tax and my diet for that day was 2 bottles of sprite and a big bar of whole nut! What can you do but eat what your body craves!! hehe xxxx
Posts.Title: cancer and diet

Posts.Content: Yeh, what is it with lemonade!!....was never bothered before! I've stopped the guilt trips too now and just eat healthier when I can. xxxx

Posts.Title: Going to ward tomorrow

Posts.Content: Well after blaming docetaxel for my utter fatigue and the fact I cant walk to another room in the house or upstairs without collapsing, pantinv f 10 minutes. I think something might be wrong so me n hubby have decided to go in in the morn. The gp did have a listen to my back and chest monday and took oxygen levels and just said chest infection but I think more. Im scared now though and been crying to hubby 'what if I dont come out?' Something about the cancer that scares me but I know Ive put up with this for weeks now and its making me miserable. Im scared it might be my lung mets out of control. Or I havent been eating/drinking as much as I should...my lips are dry so cud be dehydrated, could that show nasty symptoms? Anyway, trust me to be wallowing near xmas. Just after a wee bit of support rif anyone is around. Much love xxxxx
Posts.Title: Going to ward tomorrow

Posts.Content: Hi Rebecca, as the others have said it's a bit of a no, no with treating hair badly! I would like to get rid of my grey though so am going to ask the chemo nurses today if I can use the health shop vegetable dyes. I used to have to straighten mine as kinky and frizzy so it does look a bit of a mess, probably more to me. I tie it back though or use a clip so it's not that awful, I just can't wear it down and have it all sleek like I used to. I don't care though as long as the kids see me with my normal hair I'm quite happy. I can't work either as I'm a teaching assistant so if I have to just tie it back then all the easier :) It really is a personal decision and people's circumstances are different. I definitely thought it was worth trying and seems to be working so far but we'll see what happens after round 2 xxxx
Posts.Title: If the cap fits...

Posts.Content: Afternoon Ladies Thought I'd come on with some nice news for a change and in a good frame of mind...for a change! Day 6 post chemo, felt not too bad. Went for a nice drive in my new car and went to look at a border terrier pup...and bought him! We've been thinking about a dog for a while. Might not be the best timing but I'm looking forward to some good exercise with some long walks. Am looking forward to the kids having something to focus on besides arguing and winding each other up! We are all really excited and it has given us something nice to look forward to. We go on hol next week for 5 days then picking him up after. Still feeling sicky today but the worst effects of chemo have worn off so feeling a bit more normal. Seems a normal summer holiday day as even been shouting at the kids...they are little terrors!!! Hope everyone is feeling ok and enjoying the sun, am avoiding sitting in it as I'm not good with heat but it's nice watching the kids in the paddling pool....very tempting. Lots of love xxxxx

Posts.Title: 1 down 5 to go:))

Posts.Content: Hi Lyn Sorry to hear your news and how upset you and your husband are. I hope you get some answers on thursday as I suppose 'shadows' and 'deposits' don't really mean anything definite for you yet so hard to have a treatment plan given to you yet. I had had lung mets at diagnosis and now have a spot on liver and a few bone spots behind affected breast. Still having chemo to reduce breast lump so it can be removed with clear margins. It's been a tough year, was diagnosed in May and just want rid of this boob but just seem to be being hit with bad news each visit, so delayed surgery. My FEC chemo was working really well to start with but then stopped Having secondary does scare you but there is so much they can do and they're always telling me that and they are on top of things so I trust them but obviously have my worrying time, not much I can do but follow their plans and you read a lot of positive things like it being treated as a chronic illness etc.etc I am now on docetaxal and my Onc is hoping this is going to kick some butt. The tax is hard but just had my dose lowered and that helps. So visualising proper butt kicking!! The shock does go down and even I surprise myself at how I just get on with things, even with a manic 4 year and 7 year old boys. Just have to keep positive and living each day and taking the treatments that we're lucky to have. Hope you get all your answers Thursday and you feel you can move forward with a great treatment plan that will work for you. Sending you and your husband lots of love, it's a tough time and having each other for support will help so much. Good luck to you and let us know how you get on this week. Much love xxxxx

Posts.Content: Sue, I really feel fot you. I have secondaries to lung, liver, bone just small bits but spread is spread and I dont know if chemo wk ing so could be worse on next look. I have 3 children, a daugter 23 and 2 boys 4 & 8 and I am heartbroken. I cant have hormone treatment as I am triple negative so that narrows down my treatment plan. I still keep being told new treatments are comi g out all the time and I 'should' be able to have treatment with breaks in between. I try and think like that as much as I can but I do wobble. We all will its a ride where we dont want to think about the outcome too much but with support from family, friends and here we can get through the toughest times and not let it stop us see our children grow. All the best with your treatment plan, keep us up to date xxx
Posts.Title: its spread so scared

Posts.Content: Afternoon ladies, sorry for all my questions today! I'm 40 and was told chemo could bring on early menopause. I don't know a great deal about menopausal symptoms but I do seem to be getting hot flushes, mostly at night. I haven't had a period for the last 3 months, I know that's chemo related but how would you know if you were menopausal? Lots of love xxx
Posts.Title: Early menopause brought on by chemo

Posts.Content: Hi Dorothee You're bound to be nervous and when we're nervous other people can really get on our nerves! My hubby came with me on my first so took they day off. All morning he was 'chipper' had the radio on, talking loads when really I just wanted to be alone in my fear! Then all the way to the hospital, he was chit chatting away and I just did the odd nod of my head. I couldn't talk as I was so scared. Anyway, the chemo wasn't as bad as I thought and I got in a state for nothing really, but natural I suppose. I didn't feel too bad after but BOY did I appreciate my husband being off then!! He was brilliant, waited on me hand and foot and took care of the kids. Your mum will probably take charge when she sees she has to. Go and have a bit of 'you' time. Can you ring the nurse yourself? If not, if you're appt is booked then try not to worry too much about her ringing. Good luck for tomorrow, it'll be over before you know it and it's great they're coming to you. It definitely isn't as bad as you imagine and apart form having bad cold/cough I have felt fine. Let us know how you get on, will be thinking of you xxxxxxx

I haven't been coping well since my last onc appt where she told me surgery would be a waste of time for me (not quite in those words!) I think every day, how long have I got and i am trying to do the 'one day at a time' I keep really busy and carry on as normal etc but inside it's very hard to cope. I'm absolutely terrified of my appt tomorrow, I really can't cope hearing anything bad. I'm not sure if my lump has shrunk much this round. it did a lot the first 2 rounds so now I am scared it's not working and spreading even more. I hate this time...bloods later, onc tomorrow, chemo thursday. It just makes it all real and frightening and I don't want to be going through this. I'm sure we all feel like that, so apologies for moaning. I hope everyone is ok and will try and catch up on the posts. Lots of love and hugs to everyone xxxxx

Posts.Title: When does grieving for your breast stop?

Posts.Content: Yay! fighting talk!!! Wishing you all the best today. My Dr's are never very positive, in fact they don't say much at all. I've seen 3 different Onc's. I had a really horrible woman one who hadn't even read my notes properly. The 'main' Onc i saw first i saw again last time...he's supposed to be 'the best' never says a great deal which scares me, he does have a treatment plan though which keeps me positive. That's more due to me than him. I absolutely hate appointments, got one tomorrow :( I don't think it's even anything to do with our diagnosis/prognosis...think with some of them we're just another patient not a human being crapping ourselves, looking for a bit of comfort. We just have to rely on our wonderful family and friends for support and positiveness. Will be thinking of you, let us know how you get on xxx
Posts.Title: 1st chemo today...today I start fighting back!

Posts.Content: Hi LM I used the cold cap through my 6 FEC (just had last one-yippee!) kept my hair :) It is thinner but looks ok. I didn't cut it at all as was only shoulder length bob. My hair has always been thick so it thinning wasn't really a problem. I'm really pleased I used it. i have a 7 and 4 year old and I've looked 'normal' to them which was my main reason for doing it. Also, I've got away without having to tell all and sundry about my condition. Mainly, it's left me with a bit of confidence through this awful treatment. If I'd have lost it I'm sure I would have learnt to live with it, but I'm so glad I gave it a go. it does make treatment time longer but my hubby stayed with me or i always had a good book. It's a uncomfortable for 10-15 mins but after that you hardly notice it :) xxx
Posts.Title: A Cold cap - did it work for you?

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, we have pretty much told friends and family my 'news' most of mine and hubby's work colleagues know too. I know everyone is shocked and wants to send their thoughts but it is really upsetting me today. I am really sensitive and down and I knew as soon as everyone knew it would make it all the more real. I had a text from a friend who works with my hubby, we haven't actually met up for a long time. It said 'sorry to hear about your cancer, thinking of you x' ok nothing really offensive but the 'your cancer' reduced me to tears, it's hard enough for me to say it never mind read it as 'mine' I've had 'OMG, so sorry to hear your news' again nothing bad but 'OMG'...it's all shocked messages, nothing calm...I would like to think I would be a little more sensitive and subtle. My Mother in law has texted me twice today and asked if I feel more positive, I said no! She said she was praying for me which totally freaked me out, she may not have meant it in the way I thought...i.e. I'm dying so need praying for me!!! But it's hard to be positive with everyone's pity being bombarded at me. She has literally just sent another text to say she has just told a friend who is on hoilday in Tewksbury so now she is off to pray for me in the cathedral! It's all a bit overwhelming. I'm not having a good week and I'm worried how I'm coping as I wake up each day feelng like I can't spend it thinking about all this. I know I'm lucky to have caring family and friends but I just feel at the minute all I have is their pity and doesn't help make me strong. Sorry for the offload. Hope everyone is having a good day, the sunshine helps a bit :) xxxx.
Posts.Title: friends and family freaking me out :(

Posts.Content: Thank you all so much for your lovely, lovely replies. They had me in tears. You're all so caring and it does help so much. Saxxy, I'm sorry I've only just got on and seen your lovely offer of skyping :) I will sort out my account as I did close it for a while but my daughter is back at Uni so I need to get it sorted asap, if the offers still there maybe I could pm you with a time suitable for both of us?? I'm still very worried by it all so have left a message with Onc's secretary to get an appointment asap. My lump seems to have grown and I have seen to spots on boob now, it's red etc etc It's just so distressing as the chemo seemed to be working so I don't know what's happened. It firghtens me that the lump seems to have grown and when did chemo stop working? and has it spread more???? Have all these agonising questions 24/7. Been able to cope with everything up to now as it all seemed positive but this is just downright frightening :( Hopefully I'll have some answers and some treatment planned soon. Lots of love to all my dear friends on here xxxx
Posts.Title: Feel like I am back at square one

Posts.Content: OMG! I don't want to know any prognosis as mine is not great in their terms or statstically, I just cling to the hope that I'm an exception the rule and I plough along for years haha!! xx
Posts.Title: Feel like I am back at square one

Posts.Content: Hi Sascha Sorry you still feel like this. I feel a bit like this now, except the opposite really. I still have this manky breast, red raw...skin lesions, bigger than the other. I feel disgusted with myself. I have to hide away from hubby to dress and undress as I think he'll think I'm so gross. I can't wait to be rid of it and I was so close but then all this crap with chemo not working...new mets etc. Looks like if I'm lucky it may be next March sometime. But...time does seem to fly, only seems 5 mins since I first started chemo and I thought that would drag but seemed to fly! What I'm trying to say is time will go quickly and the 10 months will be up before you know it. I know you now have worries about the actual recon and can't actually help you there but I'm sure in the next 10 months you can do plenty of research, get lots of advice and you'll feel more confident in a decision. You are definitely depressed by it and who wouldn't be. I feel depressed, cancer and it's effects are bloody depressing we can all relate to that. Just wanted to let you know i'm thinking of you and sending you lots of love and hugs. Thank you too for your lovely reply to my message :) xxx
Posts.Title: Does it stay llike this?

Posts.Content: Hi sending you lots of love and a hug. I know exactly how you feel as I finished my chemo 2 weeks ago, I have a scan booked then onc appt to discuss next plan. It' most likely mx as long as no more spread and lung spots hopefully shrunk. It really is the not knowing what's next. When we start chemo we just seem to concentrate on getting through that, the next step seems so far away at that point but when it starts looming I think the nerves kick in. I know that's how I feel anyway. It does make you feel low, it's only natural...it's a rubbish time and it does affect out partners and family, it basically turns our lif upside down. It does kick us hard when we read about sad news, we feel for them and ourselves and it naturally frightens us. I usually try and pick myself up by reading some positive things and finding hope there. It can be so hard at times but you will pull yourself out of it and feel positive again, it's so very up and down I find it difficult to cope at times but we can and will do it. Once we're on to the next step I'm sure it will get better...and near to the end :) Treat yourself and hubby to a nice night out or a romatic meal in and push that C to the back of your mind for a night, I do this sometimes...with a nice glass of wine :) xxxx
Posts.Title: Feeling Low

Posts.Content: Hi Catherine, you're right. Felt like crying all the way home from the school run but once I'd got the appointment and the Secretary was so sympathetic I felt much better. Then I spoke to the reflexology lady and she was so lovely, I'm really looking forward to that tomorrow. And yes, am hoping the book will help a bit with my crazy mind!!! I keep seeing about people going back after surgery for pathology reports, clear margins etc but not sure what all this means. Good luck with your results on Friday, let us know how it goes xxxx

Posts.Title: Feel like I am back at square one

Posts.Content: I started my chemo at the beginning of June, 6 rounds of FEC. This was to shrink my large breast lump and also lung spots which showed up on CT scan. I responded really well, and by the 3rd round my lump had shrunk 5cmx4cm. The next 2 rounds I struggled to feel any difference, had some swelling got paranoid and worried. I had my last round 3 week ago and then thoughht I felt a difference in the lump i.e. more shrinkage.Then all last week I had tenderness and stabbing pains, this week I have had more swelling and hardness and my boob looks a lot bigger. This is how things were when I was diagnosed so I am now beside myself, I just think it's all over for me and the cancer is taking over with a vengeance. I looked on the net and saw some things that said chemo killing cancer can cause similar symptoms but I still think it's going to be bad news. I have a CT scan next friday and I am more terrified now than when I was diagnosed. I know I come here and have these panic's and I feel awful bringing everyone down so avoided posting but today I have had such a meltdown and cried myself stupid I even had thoughts of not wanting to be alive and dealing with this, only for a bit. I want to be here as long as I can for my children but all this gets so hard to deal with and I daren't face any awful news after my scan. My boob is so sore I can't get comfy in bed. I am ringing my breast nurse tomorrow, but at the moment I am feeling so sorry for myself and just wanted to offload on people who might understand. I'm scared they will say I'm untreatable now if it's the cancer again growing so quickly, it's bad enough getting my head around secondaries but I am struggling to get my head around any of this at the moment. So sorry my post is overwhelming.... I can't talk to anyone :( xxxx
Posts.Title: Feel like I am back at square one

Posts.Content: Hi Londongurl Thanks for your lovely message, I think I've started threads before that have started other 'heated debates' haha! I think you can only feel how you feel, if you know what I mean. I can't make myself be positive but I know I have positive or 'better' days. I think waiting for results etc or having something to worry about makes me negative so the stuff about CBT is very interesting. I did have counselling booked at the hospital but then found I couldn't make myself go. I was fed up of being at the hospital anyway and I was also quite scared about talking through it all...silly I know. So, the book you mentioned sounds really good and I have just ordered a new copy from amazon at £10.50 so pleased and at least while I'm reasing it I'm not thinking about 'C' I have an appointment with Onc on thursday, his wednedsay clinic was full but his secretary was lovely as I got a bit tearful and she's put me in his specialist outpatients clinic on thursday which is normally for first appointments. I've also just booked a reflexology session for tomorrow, been thinking about it for a while and then saw some positive posts on here. Just had a lovely chat with her on the phone so I'm really looking forward to it :) Thanks again. Lots of love xxxx

Posts.Title: crackly and wheezy

Posts.Content: Afternoon Ladies Had my Onc appt earlier, scared all morning but I saw TOP DOG!!! Only saw him on first appt. He has a completely different plan from horrible lady onc; Horrible lady Onc- no surgery, not worth it as won't change life outcome (her words) just chemo with breaks in between. Top Dog Onc - Said although lump shrunk, not significant enough and wants me to have surgery to remove primary tumour...er...yeh!!!!! This is what I wanted all along and couldn't understand them leaving the cancer source in my body. He also said will look at CT scan, which is booked after 6th round and if lung spots shrunk enought then they can just 'keep an eye on me' Just feel his plan is so much more positive, since lady Onc told me hers I have been so down but now I actually feel like I'm being 'treated' and feel like I have a bit of hope. Rashes on boob are from tumour being so close to skin, hopefull disappear again after this round. Thanks for the support on here, it means so much xxxxx
Posts.Title: never thought would be so happy to have surgery!!

Posts.Content: Thanks for the pathology info Franoli. It is odd that they had such different plans. I remember my appt with her and she hadn't even read my notes as started talking about surgery etc then turned to look at computer and went quiet then said 'oh' in a really downbeat way (she'd just seen the lung stuff) and then changed everything she had just said so I got the feeling she wasn't up to scratch. I will definitely ask for him and stick to what I've been told today come what may. You're right about it being hard enough without feeling your carers are not looking after you, it has affected me mentally and there's no way I am going back to her. I'll mention it tomorrow as when I go for chemo they have made your Onc appt or next time xxx

Is that what I read 'pathology' is?? have read people bordering on TN can have hormone treatment, if not think it's radiotherapy then you're out there with no further treatment but kept an eye on more xx
Posts.Title: never thought would be so happy to have surgery!!

Posts.Content: Thank you for such lovely, lovely responses :) It had definitely made a difference to my mood, I know I still have a battle and extra probs..TN/mets etc but she made it feel like there was no hope and he has given me a bit more hope as he wants to treat me if that makes sense! You need to be as positive as you can through this and this has been restored. I will definitely be sticking with him and made sure I am seeing him next time xxxx

Posts.Title: don't know what the hell to think anymore : (

Posts.Content: I don't know if any of you remeber me saying this but I trained to be a TA over the last 2 years and I got a job in March, it was only my second interview and it was a school in my area so was over the moon! I then got diagnosed in May so after just 6 weeks in my new job I had to leave to start chemo :( The school were amazing and have always said they would keep my job open. I went in today to take a sick note, everyone was so pleased to see me and hugging me it was quite emotional! I have my last chemo next week and then surgery is planned but not sure when. I know you have to have at least 6-8 weeks break from last chemo so work have asked if I'd like to come back for a few months at least and I must admit I was sooooo excited by the idea, there's no reason why I can't. It was only because of the chemo/low immunity I couldn't go to work. the thought of doing something normal again has really made my day and now I can't wait. Ideally, I wouldn't have surgery until the new year and then I can get 2 terms in :) I don't think I'd have to have too much time off post surgery so could get back again. Only worry is lung spots, if they haven't gone/shrunk. There will be more chemo planned BUT I can worry about that when I need to and just enjoy living a normal life for a bit xxxx

Posts.Content: Hi Helen So sorry you are feeling like this. Glad you have an appointment book and hope this helps. Sorry to hear your surgery has left you in pain. I hope this starts to ease soon. Could you perhaps give her a ring and voice your concerns, it might help with things. Sending you a big hug and I hope you start to feel better very soon xxx

It's my last chemo tomorrow so he talked about CT scan, meeting breast surgeon etc. He read all the notes into his computer as usual and listening to him it all sounded scary :( It's not like I don't know what's happening but I suppose now chemo coming to an end and all 'the what next' questions and 'how long' morbid questions. Posts.Title: IBC

Posts.Content: You have hit the 'bullseye' there. Out of 4 onc appointments i have seen 3 different Oncs....well Onc on first appt then two of his registrars. Onc seemed ok but didn't tell me a lot on that first appt as he could see I was anxious. His registrar v.blunt on next appointment, hadn't read my notes and has left me terrified ever since. I saw someone different last time, he was lovely and had a nice manner. Some continuity would help as then I might feel able to open up with them and feel comfortable asking things. I wonder who I'll get tomorrow!! I think you're right, to most of them we're just another cancer case and they are going by the text books i really wish i had a good onc who I felt was on my side and was really going out of their way to help. I was told that Derby was excellent for treatment and my Onc was the best there was, shame i've only had one quick appt with him. xxx

You've helped so many people and you've taken time to reply with really positive comments. TBH, I was close to putting the exact same thread title. I feel I don't belong here. With having the lung mets and then being told no surgery and basically feeling I don't have long left, I feel I'm different to everyone on here and I feel upset that I'm not having the usual treatment and the same treatment as others...chemo/surgery etc I'm the odd one out :(  BUT.........it isn't all about our treatments, it's about our love and support for each other and helping each other through the bad times and I can honsetly say this is the only place that does that. I think you need that support as well. Nobody wants you to go anywhere. I'm sorry you feel like this, I haven't been on here for a few days and don't know what's happened but stay with us please. Lots of love xxxx

I think I should probably take the pressure off while I'm having treatment. I'm a bit scared as have small nodules on lungs and things I've read have said I'll never be 'cured' put a LOT of pressure on. Scared me into changing a lot of eating habits. I'm sort of vegan, but i find the first few days after chemo i can only eat PROPER cheese sandwiches. Not the fake crap i buy or the soya cheese but proper, proper cheese...mmmmm. Have to do it else would starve! Cheese sandwiches and soda water get me through. Might be adding some rose to that myself as a treat at some point! Thanks for your reply xxxx

Posts.Content: Hi Jellytot Brill news re shrinkage. What a good news week :) Is that a Border terrier in your pic, I think it was you who mentioned having one. We got ours last Friday, he's 13 weeks old now. Settled in lovely. Called him Hank. Such and affectionate, loving pup :) xxxx
Posts.Title: best onc app ever

Posts.Content: Yay! and Yay! again! What a massive relief for you. I'm so pleased. I'm wondering why they said you'd only be managed and not cured? Enjoy your tea tonight, you deserve something extra special....champagne!!! Lots of love xxx
Posts.Title: best onc app ever

Posts.Content: Evening! I have 2 cancer diet books and tbh, I was pretty much following their advice before reading. I am kind of a vegan who eats fish. I was a vegetarian but decided fish would be really good for me. I eat loads beans/pulses etc. buy them organic and dried from my local health shop. I am really good about 75% of the time and I know for my health I should really make more of an effort but I gave up alcohol, well wine. Hubby and I would share a couple of bottles over the weekend or a bit more if we entertained. maybe an odd one in the week. I think giving it up has given me a sugar craving as I never had a sweet tooth before but have been a bit naughty with cakes, sweets, chocs. Was never that interested before, was always a savoury gal. I'm also finding once I start to  feel well again after chemo it's like my hunger motor kicks in. Tonight I had a chippy tea..chips, fishcakes and mushy peas and I've just eaten a doughnut. I feel sick haha!! I'm a bit mad with myself as know this won't be doing me any good. Yesterday I ate a really big bag of crisps, I mean the big family bag things followed by a cream cake. I will get back to eating healthily tomorrow but I thinks it's my body craving stuff after feeling so ill for 4 days after chemo. I just wondered if anyone else went through similar once they were out of the chemo rut. Glad I'm wearing jeggings today, elasticated waist..mmmmmmm xxxxxx
Posts.Title: eating like a big fat pig!

Posts.Content: Don't fell bad my lovely, it's rubbish what we're going through so whinge away. You've got a lot coming up and it causes a lot of stress. The only good thing about my chemo is that i know i have NO appointments for 3 weeks. It's appointments that cause most stress. Scans too! i have my second CT scan on 3rd Oct and worried already. Don't think I've cheered you up but I know how you are feeling so don't know if that helps! It won't last forever, don't worry about showing your true feelings it does us good. I'm a right whingebag haha!! xxx
Posts.Title: S**T !! Fed Up With The Stress Of It All !!!

Posts.Content: haha! thanks ladies. My life is one constant guilt trip at the moment. I did laugh out loud Tinkers, about eating the pickles then drinking the vinegar! I couldn't help think of Homer Simpson! No offence!! It is a lot of comfort eating, you're right. Going to try and walk some of my podgy belly off tomorrow! Yes Rebecca, definitely good for the soul. Not many treats in life at the moment. At least I've been good with wine, half of that is because, like tea I can't seem to face it anyway. Although, I wouldn't drink through chemo..you feel bad enough anyway! xx
Posts.Title: eating like a big fat pig!

Posts.Content: There seems to be a few ladies on here who have just had their first chemo and found it not too bad. I'm really hoping that I'll be the same. I am feeling really nervous now. I went to the chemo unit yesterday to talk over with the nurse what would be happening and ask any questions. I also had a 'tour' and was sized up for a cold cap which I'm going to give a go. It all felt very surreal and very real and this is really all happening. I'm a bit scared and got even more scared with all the 'rapid response' talk. I know it's all a good thing and I will be finally doing something to try and get rid of this. Can't seem to get rid of the butterflies though. Got my heart scan today, seems that I am never away from the hospital at the moment. At least after chemo tomorrow I won't have any appts booked in for nearly 3 weeks. Hoping everyone is ok Lots of love and hugs xxx
Posts.Title: First chemo tomorrow

Posts.Content: Sending you a big hug xxx I'm the same as Ruth and sicky/out of it for 5-6 days then I start to feel a lot better and try to carry on as normal then. I always give myself things to look forward to on the good weeks, days out, friends round etc...just cram everything in!!! The sickness is the downside of FEC, but I think it is one of the better chemo's. My Onc said on a scale of 1-10 it's about 4 in regards of being nasty. Hope you feel better soon, mention it to your Onc on your next visit, if you're feeling really rough they may lower your dose so it's more bearable xxx
Posts.Title: TIRED AND SICK WTH FEC

Posts.Content: Hi Mary I think I just feel this will be where I start to look and feel 'ill' Have felt well up to now, physically! And keep being told I look well, twice by hospital staff. I've just been doing things as normal up to now but it's all going to change so it makes me nervous. Yes, the chemo nurse said do a dairy as she said you should get the same 'symptoms' on the same day each cycle so then you will know what to expect. I have my orange ice lollies ready and ice packs on the freeze to take tomorrow. The nurse did say even if I don't feel great after my first session it doesn't mean the others will be as bad. I'll let you know about the cold cap. Lots of love xxx
Posts.Title: First chemo tomorrow

Posts.Content: Thanks ladies, can't stop thinking about it at the moment. I think I'll prob be ok when I'm having it am scared incase I feel really ill after. Dorothee...am worried about hair loss now, didn't think about it too much before so I thought I'd give the cold cap a go, if I can stand it it! It's just a shame it adds 2 and half hours to the session but will be worth it if it works. I t does sound like the delivery suite tour! I felt a bit awful really as people were sat having their chemo. I am taking my husband but have been told you can only have someone with you for your first cycle just because it gets busy in there. She did say if I really wanted someone I could do but I'm not bothered really. They did say not to drive home though and get someone to pick me up when I go on my own. I got a bit upset when they were talking about germs etc, I have 2 young children and they said if they get ill to have no contact/kiss them etc I'm usually the one who looks after them when they are ill...cuddle them etc. I know it's not forever but that did start the tears rolling. lots of love xxxx
Posts.Title: First chemo tomorrow

Posts.Content: Hi everyone I've been taking these for 30 days now and I don't feel any different, if anything I am crying/worrrying more every day. I just really need something to work asap.I think I am getting worse as it's leading up to xmas and I am having to leave hubby to everything. I am a useless blob. I got so upset this morning and hubby broke down as well, he was talking about if I hadn't got long left and the hospital weren't being 'honest' with me and that a book the macmillan nurse left had not left his mind. She'd left 3. One called 'Mummys lump' another about talking to children about cancer and ANOTHER for children when a parent dies :( OK I'm not kidding myself in any of this. I have mets and am triple negative so really not the best outcome but this was like a massive smack in the teeth. I can't grab any hope from anywhere anymore, been trawling forums and depressing myself. I used to have a bit of fighting spirirt. I know hubby is scared, worn out from kids/housework and he doesn't have anyone to talk to. I feel so scared too now, it's been a wierd day. Lots of 'triple negative secondaries' talk months, even with treatment. How do I fight, especially with tax being such a beast. Am I even fighting for anything much? :( :( xxxxx
Posts.Title: Mirztipine

Posts.Content: Wishing you good results and that it's over for you. Hope you get a nice rest this weekend xxxx
Posts.Title: Glad to be back home after op

Posts.Content: Was never even asked about the picc line and can't say I would have agreed. My veins are ok at the moment so don't mind the canula, never been too bad with needles. Can see the 'perks' of a picc line if you are though. xx
Posts.Title: Coil Marker

Posts.Content: Hi I can't work, unfortunately as I work in a school and was told mixing with lots of children would be bad for my immunity and could easily pick something up. So that was the decision made for me. I didn't know how I would react to chemo, have had 2 so far and even if I could work I definitely wouldn't be able to for at least a week as that's when I feel pretty crap and then days 7-10 your immune system is supposed to drop so it doesn't leave a lot a time to work! That said from I have loads of energy this round and could have managed work say days 12-20? I only work part time. Further along the line I may get more tired, I don't know. If you have set hours on set days and there is no flexibility it migt be difficult. Do you have a 'boss' you can talk to about your hours? People do and have worked through chemo. I miss my job and the time it occupies, leaves me to dwell to much! That said I have a 3 year old and 7 year old and tbh I am loving being here for them :) It is hard to plan for the future, in my head it was chemo then surgery/rads. All done and dusted for the end of the year, back to work in January. But, having to wait to see how I respond to chemo first so that's my timescale out the window! I hope you don't stress too much, work is important but you being well enough to get through all this and cope with chemo etc is important. Good luck with it all xxxx
Posts.Title: Will I be able to work through treatment?

Posts.Content: Loving your good news and your good vibes....just what we need on here. Thanks for sharing and here's hoping the other 3 are as successful and knowing how well it's doing get's you through it easier :) xxxxx

Posts.Content: Thanks Marilyn Sorry to hear you have lung mets too. Hope you find some treatment that doesn't make you feel so ill. Posts.Title: Triple negative and lung mets, is there any hope? :(

Posts.Content: Hi Sassy, glad it seems a bit better for you. Hope your BC nurse gets back to you xxx Very funny Sascha!! I'm much better with other people's problems AND I think I'm in a much better frame of mind, for now!!! xxx
Posts.Title: MRI dye grrrrrr - 3 weeks on still itching like a crackhead

Posts.Content: Hi Sassy Sending a big hug from rainy Derby, I think having BC gives us the right to worry about other illnesses, side effects and becoming hypochondriacs! I know I expect the worst now, it changes your frame of mind. You know the google rule!!!!! It never really helps, we all do it though to try and find a bit of comfort and then I always find something to fuel the fear as you have! How are things now? I think you should ring the GP back, I think considering you're a BC patient and you have been suffering so long they should see you immediately. I don't thinking sitting in A&E for 4 hours with potential germs is a good idea. What about the rapid response chemo number? They might ask you to come in and sort it for you as it is related to your condition. I can imagine having another health problem on top of everything else does not help your state of mind and I really feel for you. Lots of love and an extra big hug xxxxx
Posts.Title: MRI dye grrrrrr - 3 weeks on still itching like a crackhead

Posts.Content: Hi Rusty Sorry you've had to join us, but it was definitely the right thing to do. This forum does really help and support and i know I've made some wonderful supportive friends who have made this journey a hell of a lot easier. It is a massive rollercoaster ride with one day being different to the next but as long as we have more positive days, that's good :) Keep coming on here it does keep the emotions a bit clamer, and if it's hard to talk to family and friends there is always someone here to listen. Good luck with your surgery next week and let us know how you get on. Lots of love xxx
Posts.Title: New to all this!!

Posts.Content: Hi Dorothee Thanks for your reply, I am scared at the moment :( I knew the more info I had I would eventually use it to panic myself! I have got some counselling booked next week so hoping that will help me offload but still a worry all this trip neg/lungs etc I don't know too much about treating secondaries and am worried that because there are no 'after drugs' with trip neg that it applies to lung stuff as well. I just daren't look for anymore info. I have 3rd chemo in 2 weeks and they did say they would do another CT scan after to check lump and lung nodule shrinkage. I think I can probably ask more then as they will know how I am responding to treatment. My lump has shrunk a lot in just 2 sessions so maybe the nodules will have too or maybe they'll be worse and spread...that's my mindset at the moment :( How are you doing now, so sorry to hear you were ill after the first chemo. As if there's not enough to deal with!!! I hope you are feeling a lot better and your next chemo experience is a bit better! I had a chest infection on my first chemo, am on Day 10 now and so far am ok. I was ill by this time last time. I have got a bit of a sore mouth which started today so can tell I'm getting 'low' and feeling bit more tired but my sickness wore off quicker this time. Hope you're feeling ok and thanks again for the reply :) xxxxx
Posts.Title: Triple negative and lung mets, is there any hope? :(

Posts.Content: It's me again in one of my low moods. Yesterday I had a brilliant day, I didn't think about being ill at all it was really wierd. Just felt so normal and happy and then today my mood has really dropped and it's as though it 's making up for yesterday. Only found out I was triple neg last weekend, been in a morbid mood trawling the internet. Ended up on breastcancercare as a lot of activity on their secondaries forum. I also didn't realise the full extent of triple neg :(  and then triple neg with secondaries has just upset me more as there is no treatment for me after chemo, surgery, rads so my body can just let it spread wherever it likes :( The only positive I read about TN was it responds to chemo and I can definitely tell, My mini football size lump is now about egg size-still huge I suppose in terms of prognosis etc but it is good. I am also scared as i haven't had an MRI or bone scan so it could be somewhere else now I've read how aggressive TN is. Just obsessing now and after such a positive day yesterday I just feel angry too. Sorry for the melodrama xxx
Posts.Title: Triple negative and lung mets, is there any hope? :(

Posts.Content: Morning Ladies. Hope everyone is well. Have suffered with migraines since I was 14. As I've got older they've been less frequent. Over the last 2 weeks though I've had 4. I'm hoping it's a combination of all the FEC's (just had last one last week) and been run down/low. I was getting quite tired just before the last FEC and I had to have my bloods done again on chemo day as they were still low, that was the first time that had happened. Me being me though, am also scaring myself about something being 'wrong' Just wondered if anyone who suffers migraines has experienced similar? Love and hugs to you all xxx

Posts.Title: Alcohol

It's gone so quick and although I'm scared of future treatment etc I do actually feel like a big step is over and relief :) Although i may have to have more chemo in the future I'm hoping it won't be as bad as FEC or as intense i.e. every 3 weeks. Posts.Title: Just had last FEC :-)

Posts.Content: Hi Ladies I used to like my wine :P I gave up after diagnosis, well after my first Onc appt which is over a month ago. I don't mind that much as it's more important to get well. I'm just wondering who gave up, who has a bit etc. I actually had a glass last night as I just felt like a treat after a shitty few weeks. I know I've read odd glass of red wine can be good for you, but can't drink that. I just thought maybe a small glass or 2 at the end of my 'good week' each month, life is pretty crap going through this  but I kinda feel guilty today!! Lots of love xxxxx
Posts.Title: Alcohol

Posts.Content: Hi all Am sure you're all fed up of me by now! I've come to the conclusion that I have a very aggressive, fast growing tumour...FEC worked for a bit. It measured 10x8cm after round 3 or 4, I forget now! But now boob is swollen and lump has grown BUT when I hopefully see onc this week I am desperate for them to say they will take the f***ing thing out, sorry for the foul language but I have spent 10 months arseing about with this lump, it's so distressing obssessing over it. Onc said surgery would be next but now with this spanner in the works I'm worried he'll say more chemo. When I say worried, I'll be glad I can still be treated but if it's this aggressive I just really want it out now...I think they will see how distressed i am as i know I am going to cry at this next appointement. I also want it out so it can't spread anymore. As you can see I am totally obsessed with my BC at the moment, it's just a bit of a nightmare as we all know. i hope everyone is having a good weekend and I hope I get this appointmeny asap so i don't have to keep badgering you lovely ladies. Lots of love xxx
Posts.Title: will they be able to do surgery on a BIG lump

Posts.Content: thanks both you. I'm ringing to get an appointment this wed when he does his clinic, I will cry and beg down the phone if I have to. It will definitely be a MX, my skin is awful and I would prefer to have the whole boob off as a safety precaution...never thought there'd be a day where I'd be desperate to lose a boob!!! But, it can't come soon enough for me. Thank you for your kind words, I'll keep you updated and hopefully have news of an appointment tomorrow xx
Posts.Title: will they be able to do surgery on a BIG lump

Posts.Content: Hi Danielle Glad the lumpectomy is out of the way and hope you start to feel a bit better soon. Good luck with the results on your nodes. It's natural to be scared of chemo, I was terrified. Couldn't even speak on the way to my appointment. But it was really ok. The chemo nurse was lovely and it was all pretty straight forward. I have felt fine since as well. Day 1-5 I felt very sicky and tired but the meds really helped and the sickness tabs work very quickly. I haven't been sick. Each day I have felt better. Am 10 days past now and a bit tired today but overdid it yesterday. It really isn't bad at all. I have 5 more rounds to go so hoping they'll all be like this. I wanted to try the cold cap but, again, wasn't looking forward to it but it was ok. Very cold for about 10-15 mins then you get used to it. It's downside is you have to have it on 45 mins before and 2 hours after treatment so it does make for a long session but worth it if it works. I keep reading hair tends to come out 2 weeks after first chemo so we'll see what happens next week! Sending you a big hug xxxx
Posts.Title: had my lumpectomy yesturday

Posts.Content: Hi I'm sure you did but was just wondering if they give you steroids 24 hours BEFORE treatment? I was giving these this week before starting tax as they said it can help stop a reaction. They too told me about the hotness being the first sign.....not a good idea planting seeds in my head as as soon as I felt a bit warm i got paranoid! Luckily I was ok though. Sorry you had a reaction and now have a delay, i would have been gutted too. Hope you get sorted soon xxx
Posts.Title: Allergic reaction to tax
