Posts.Title: had my 3rd tax and blood transfusion

Posts.Content: Thank you so much for thinking of me especially as AWOL for a while. I'm 7 days post tax, on antibiotics for chest infection and in a really crap place. I'm convinced its got me. Am still having trouble breathing. Saw gp yesday who had good listen to chest and back and took oxygen level. Said all to do with infection. I can't walk upstairs without almost collapsing, my legs feel so weak, I feel so 'ill' when I have to be on the move. Feel ok when in bed and hubby says I have colour. Is it the tax? I cry every night thinking aggressive cancer has it grip. TMI my manky boob is now covered in ulcers etc and is being dressed everyday. I can't even tell now if tax is working as I cant feel a lump as boob is just hard. I get the feeling its not working like the FEC and am now untreatable with all my mets as well. I'm sorry this must be the most morbid post ever, but just feel so awful. Can tax make u so weak and disabled? Deep down I cant stop thinking about dying 24/7. Just cant beloeve Im in this position :( xxx

Posts.Title: had my 3rd tax and blood transfusion

Posts.Content: Brilliant thread ladies, I shall be doing a bit of online shopping this morning. Simple stuff, I thought would be ok but tbh I haven't been checking the stuff I already have. My new shampoo/conditioner is from body shop though and they are paraben free xxx
Posts.Title: Parabens

Posts.Content: Morning everyone I have my CT scan on Monday and now I am having all those negative feelings and dread and worry etc I then have my first onc appt on wed plus the results so I will be a wreck before long. I have been very up and down since diagnosis last week and last night I had a big cry to hubby who cried too. I have been looking at boys a bit older than mine and wondering if I'll see them at that age and thinking all sorts of dark thoughts that just came to a head last night. Hubby and I had been out for a lovely meal as well and I just wished our life was normal again and I could just fully enjoy everything. I am so scared of the scan showing something as I have large lump and sore/swollen armpit for months, it's had time to get around. if they tell me this then I just don't know how to have any hope for treatment or beating this :( My lump is already a problem as it's so large and needs to be shrunk by chemo so even that is a big worry for me incase it doesn't work. I know I have probably gone over this so many times but I just feel like these obstacles are going to be a problem somehow and my treatment won't be straight forward....maybe just my huge negativity but I can't seem to drag any positivity into myself at the moment and I'm trying to. I'm paranoid at the moment as well with the hot weather, as only wearing tops I can't hide the fact that one boob is obviously bigger that the other and feel that everyone is looking. Feeling a bit of a freak! I know I'm a moaning Minnie on here, I look forward to the day when I can post soething positive. Hope you all have a good weekend in the lovely weather. I was a bit panic stricken as thought it was growing, but others told me on here that that was normal and the chemo doing it's work. It stopped hurting and the swelling went down. the last few days it has felt smaller and my bra hasn't felt as uncomfortable. I decided to try on a bra that had got way too uncomfortable to wear and use it almost as a test to see if it fitted me again, and it does!!!!! It had gotten that my boob would not fit in the 'cup' at all but now it does again. It is still bigger than my other boob and still needs a lot more shrinking but am feeling really positive now after just one round of chemo :) xxxxx

Posts.Title: horrible onc appt, horrible news

Posts.Content: Hi Kelly Definitely the right place, just sorry you've had to join. You will get amazing support. Your feelings are the natural feelings we've all been through and the shock is awful but I promise you it does 'get better' I was diagnosed a couple of weeks after my 40th birthday. I knew something wasn't right and was expecting bad news but it was still a shock for me and family. I have a 22 year old daughter at Uni and 2 boys at home, 7 and 3. I went through all the same feelings as you about my youngest especially. Worried myself sick how my 7 year old would be a he is an anxious child, sometimes telling me before school he'll miss me and looking like he will cry. I used to cry on the way home thinking how he would cope without me. We all have these morbid thoughts to start as we have no idea what's going to happen and it's the 'C' word. I had 3 weeks of different tests, I was at the hospital 3 times a week I was still terrified and in shock the whole time. I daren't tell family and friends what I thought or my fears as I didn't want to scare them so I use this site an awful lot and it has helped so much to calm lots of fears and i have some lovely friends on here. I have a large breast lump and some spots on my lungs so I am having chemo first to try and shrink stuff down. I had my first chemo last week and it wasn't as bad as I thought and am feeling quite good this week (touch wood!) I also feel that the shock has worn off now and you will find it does too. it is all up and down and good days and bad days. I still think when I look back at my posts from the beginning I am generally calmer about stuff, it's hard at your when you're at the beginning to think you will feel any better but you will and you will be around for your children as treatment is amazing. I still have a cry when something sets me off, do it...it will help. Keep coming on here for support and feel free to message me if you need to talk. Lots of love and a big hug xxxxxx

I don't know why I was passed to her, I'm paranoid that it's because my original Onc thinks I'm not worth dealing with as I've not got long. I have woken up this morning with all the most depressing thoughts going through my head, I also have chemo later so dreading that. I don't know how to pick myself up or stop focusing on all these horrible thoughts. I keep gong off for a cry where no one can see me as i don't want to worry them. Sorry for being like this, I know I need to be strong. I appreciate everything everyone has said. Picking up my car did take my mind off things for a bit...Dorothee-it's a new shape vauxhall meriva, very nice :) We took my hubby's parents out in it and went for a meal. I couldn't stop myself having a couple of glasses of wine, it helped for a bit. Not great night before chemo but needed something for the shock. bed bound after today's chemo and am dreading how this round will affect my already, very low mood. Sending love to all of you, I know we're all in the same boat so sorry for being so self-absorbed at the moment. I'm sure I'll be up and fighting soon. Lots of love and hugs to you all xxxxxx
Posts.Title: horrible onc appt, horrible news

Posts.Content: HI Kelly Sorry you're feeling so anxious, it is VERY normal and I think everyone's worst nightmare is it's spread everywhere. I had lung mets on diagnosis so already had spread but I was/am still treatable. All I am trying to say is you could be worrying unnecessarily or if the cancer has spread you will still have lots and lots of options. i know this is a bit of a blunt reply and i hope I've not upset you. I'm not saying any of the symptoms point to this (I had bleeding piles on FEC :S) and tbh the lung stuff with me was a surprise as I'd had NO symptoms at all. Our mind can go bonkers and be very cruel to us. Why don't you ask your ONC for a CT scan? Tell him how much you are worrying, this could put your mind at rest? I'm so sorry to hear about your Dad and this obviously heightens your fear of cancer. Sending you lots of love and a big hug, I hope things feel a bit better soon xxx
Posts.Title: Is it normal to be feeling like this?

Posts.Content: Hi Sascha, not a great deal of advice from me. I didn't know what to do with my hair, I was going to have it cut short just before 1st chemo but then thought what's the point of paying for a haircut if it's going to fall out. I asked the chemo nurse if cutting my hair short would make any difference and she said no. My hair isn't too long. it's a bob about up to bottom of neck. My hair is VERY thick though so I was hoping with the cold cap it might just 'thin out' It just looks a bit of mess at the moment as I can't blow dry or straighten it so it's a bit frizzy and I'm all grey at the roots :( I don't think it's trivial and I hope you get some advice. I know my hair looking a bit crap makes me feel a bit crap so you go ahead and treat yourself to a colour and cut :) xx
Posts.Title: Hair colour??

Posts.Content: Just looking at my skype account as not used it for a bit so hopefully if you're around we can finally have a chat :) xxxxxx
Posts.Title: Saxxy....are you around my love?

Posts.Content: Hi Thanks for the tips. Have been making myself drink lots of water and little bites of crackers. I always seem to have an appetite for my tea though. You're right Catherine, mornings are not good and not just for a few hours ALL morning haha! I'm sure it will get better. I went to sleep at 1pm and then got up a 4pm so my body sure does need it. I hope it's all helping. I have an hours school run which dreading but hubby taking Sam to nursery and I may have to nip Will in the car, I can't imagine walking it. I was only given all the sickness meds for 2 days, must mention it next time that could do with them lasting a few more days. (apart from the mets) Am just having a panic as hubby back at work but my mum is coming up tomorrow. I'm sure it's all doing me good and it's good it doesn't last all day. I ate my tea outside so some nice fresh air, the sun has actually come out here! Here's hoping for a better day tomorrow and thanks for the advice lovely ladies. Lots of love xxx
Posts.Title: Day 4 after FEC-still green around the gills

Posts.Content: Hi everyone Have felt v.sicky since first FEC on thurs. Not been sick and meds have helped, although some of those have gone now but got some metoclopramide. I have mostly stayed in bed as not feeling great. it's probably not quite as bad as I expected but still not great. I feel awful in the mornings and can't get with it until late afternoon. I feel like I did when I was pregnant. The thought of food making me heave, very tired, constantly nauseous, water and tea have started to turn my stomach. I know it could be a lot worse than this, but I had a bit of a cry today as not felt physically up to anything. Hubby has been brilliant with kids but just wish I could be doing a bit more. I know it's early days, just wondering from anyone elses experience when they start to feel a bit better? I got my period yesterday which was shitty timing and isn't helping but just looking for a bit of light at the end of the tunnel. Thanks xxxx
Posts.Title: Day 4 after FEC-still green around the gills

Posts.Content: Tax is a real sh*t. i am either freezing cold to the point where i can't get warm. I'm sat here in my living room with the central heating on, the fire on. A jumper, a poncho, a hat and a scarf and I'm only just starting to warm through. If I was 'normal' I'd be passing out now!!! Later on when I go to bed...I'll be hot, sweaty and kicking the covers of because I'm too hot and having a flush....can't win!!! xxxxxx
Posts.Title: Feeling hot and nights sweats anyone....

Posts.Content: oooohhh, does that mean you should be asked to be tested again? Or would they look at it again after surgery. When would they expect it to change? Thanks for the info Sascha, will try and look at the full article. Can't imagine a miracle like that would happen for me but I'm going to bear it in mind xxx
Posts.Title: News for Triple negative cancer diagnosis

Posts.Content: Hi You're not being silly. I'm having a rubbish time on it at the moment and am going to mention it at my next appointment but I am also worried that if they reduce it will it work? Should I just put up with it knowing it's at it's hardest?? That said, we have to have some quality of life and I think we are given the highest dose to see how we cope and they do have a limit they can come down to. They know what they're doing and it's no good them making us more ill, more prone to infection etc. I don't think you can be expected to stick to your original dose with what you've been through Sending you a big hug xxx
Posts.Title: Reduction in Docetaxal/Tax has anyone else had this? Will it still...

Posts.Content: Finally given in and cut my hair today. I had already decided I couldn't face a second go at the cold cap so soon after the first. Have wigs/hats.etc but been clinging on to hair. Think it's because I had so much growing back on the top from some of the bits I lost with FEC. But I seemed to be hanging on to my rats tail of a pony tail for dear life! I wasn't brave enough to go for the whole bare scalp look so did a high grade and just looks like a really short crop, it's amazing how thick it has got on top! It looks and feels a million times better but I did cry like a baby throughout!! Hubby said he loves it...bless him...I knew he would. He said he wasn't just saying that and that I looked like I had been to the hairdressers haha! It's done now, I'm going to go to town in a bit and look for another nice hat and some pretty earings. Got to have some retail therapy after that! Hope you ladies are all ok and have some nice plans for the weekend xxxx
Posts.Title: Got the hair clippers out this morning!

Posts.Content: Hi everyone. my name is Annabel. I am 40 years old with husband and 3 children- 22, 7 and 3. I don't know how I've gone on these last few months but to cut a long story short I am booked in the breast clinic on Monday and expecting the worst. I seem to have all the classic signs of IBC. It didn't start like that, I had a lump/thickening that I didn't notice for a while so not sure how long it was there. Went to Dr and said to wait until my next period. It didn't go..i actually waited a couple of periods. It continued to grow and went red so visited the Dr. I hate to admit I was terrified after googling and it took a few weeks to go back. Dr thought after a look and feel that it was an infected cyst and gave anti-biotics...the breast redness did seem to go down but still pink. I know I have most of the symptoms of IBC and a very hard mass in my breast so I kind of know it's not good, if that makes sense. i've tried to fob myself off with cysts/fibroadenomas etc but I think i need to accept what's coming. I'm not being a drama queen about it, in fact I have been carrying on as normal through the day, doing my job as a TA looking after the kids etc. At night I'm in bed terrified and crying for my children, I can't bear not to be here for them. I haven't spoken to anyone about this in all the time of my worrying. I think I must have been in a bit of denial. I have only just start to talk about it because of the breast clinic to my husband, best friend and Mother in law. Everyone is really dismissive and telling me it will just be a cyst when I know it it's going to be bad. I'm sorry if I am waffling, I just felt the need today to try and talk to people going through similar. I'm almost at the point...and I apologise if this is really insensitive...where I just want the diagnosis and just get on with getting better instead of all the worry and wondering of the last few months. But then I think about the treatment and I am terrified. I'm sorry for posting here but I couldn't find a forum for 'worried' and am pretty sure I'll be a proper member next week if you know what I mean :( Thank you for reading.
Posts.Title: Breast clinic next week but expecting and trying to prepare for bad...

Posts.Content: Hi bobby I hope you've had your results by now, the worry is so much worse and you will feel better knowing and having a treatment plan. It helps to come on here with your fears, we are a very caring bunch and really support each other. We all go through the exact same thoughts at the beginning. Hopefully you are now in the know and taking steps forward to beat this. Lots of love xxx

Thanks. xxxx

Posts.Title: Breast clinic next week but expecting and trying to prepare for bad...

Posts.Content: Hi Debra. Thank you so much for your positive post, this is just the kind of thing I need to hear! I am so pleased to hear how well you are, even though you must have been through such an awful time. What an inspiration! Thank you for your reply and good wishes xx
Posts.Title: Breast clinic next week but expecting and trying to prepare for bad...

Posts.Content: Hi Sailor Girl I'm sorry yours wasn't s good experience, was it definitely the 'look good, feel better' I only ask as the goody bags given out are the same for all workshops...they even have the 'look good feel better' logo on the actual bag. The bag was like a really large make up bag. The session I went to was 2 hours long as well as they went through the whole 12 steps beauty routine. You're not being moany, it doesn't sound like it lived up to the usual look good stuff so might be worth mentioning it to someone as you said. Lots of love xxx
Posts.Title: Look good feel better

Posts.Content: Afternoon Ladies Just have to say you MUST try and get on this course if it's run by your hospital. If you google 'look good feel better uk' it will bring up their site and hospitals that do it. It is such a boost. We were given a good bag...oh my! It had £250 worth of stuff in it, I kid you not. There were things like Chanel lipstick, clinique face cream, all top brand make up/face stuff stuff like lancome, elizabeth arden etc Everyone even had a bottle of perfume...big size, mine was Armani code...saw online that was £70 alone. Just in shock! We got to use all our stuff and were shown step by step how to use it and the best way to apply the make up. Brilliant for me as I've never really worn make up much as no clue how to put it on properly. It was lovely to speak to other women and it was really nice to see us all just excited and happy and all looking fabulous by then end of it. The volunteers who run it were brilliant too. Everyone came out feeling really lifted. I really needed that this week! Am really impressed that these big companies donate all these products and that 'look good feel better' is a charity. Such a fantastic idea for us ladies who are going through a crap time in our lives. Lots of love xxxxxx
Posts.Title: Look good feel better

Posts.Content: Hi Lady in Red When I went to book mine, the macmillan lady said hospitals have to put bids in to try and get the course there as look good, feel better are a charity and can only do so many hospitals. Apparently the one I went to at Derby has only been running since September and they said they were really lucky to have their bid accepted. Your hospital may have put a bid in too but been unsuccessful, if not though it's a brilliant idea to start a campaign. It really is a lovely, positive, morale boosting thing in a time when our lives need it. That said, if I were you I would drive 30-40 miles....worth it just for the goody bag ;) xxxxx
Posts.Title: Look good feel better

Posts.Content: Don't you call yourself a wimp!!! You're an amazing, stong woman who has been through a hell of a lot so it would be natural to have the odd meltdown. It will do you good and you don't have to have a particular reason, it's just an extrememly emotional time and these emotions have to come out...good or bad. It's still early days for you and it won't be long before you are back to normal. keep having a good cry if it helps. Hope you are feeling a bit better today. sending you a big hug xxx
Posts.Title: so fed up of it all

Posts.Content: Hiya yes, give them a call asap. they get booked up quite quickly. You will love it, it's such a treat :) xxxx
Posts.Title: Look good feel better

Posts.Content: Hi Fiona It really doesn't sound like 'look good feel better' Have a look at their website. They really go out of their way to help you use the products. There was one lady 'presenting' and at least 4 others helping and all their designer products are donated by big companies as they are a charity. I met some nice women too, at different stages and we all agreed it was such a boost and we all felt special being given the bags and products. It really does make your day/week especially going through all this crap!! xxxx
